All Reviews

  1. Not as good as the other fabric shaver I had. But it will do for sweaters that aren't so bad.
  2. As described. Works great!
  3. Easy to use. I use it to shave my sweaters and coats. But it is so sharp sometimes. I had made a hole on one of my sweaters. Just be careful while using it.
  4. We bought this initially to remove the all too common fuzzball from our clothes. It does a decent job but depending on the situation, it might not do a perfect job. I had one shirt that was basically all scuffed up on the back from a zipline harness. I don't have a picture before using this fabric shaver but here's took a picture of what it looks like afterwards. This t-shirt is 60% cotton and 40% polyester like most of my shirts. I did the best I could with removing the fuzzballs and in the end, the shirt's fabric look a little washed out. There were still some fuzziness but the shaver couldn't remove those anymore. This shaver does a good job in most cases when it's a small job. In my extreme case, the harness I was wearing for my zipline adventure just caused way too much damage. Other shirts that have less fuzzballs are removed without any issues.<br /><br />We have since used this shaver on other fabrics like bed sheets, pillow cases and blankets. Unless those bed fabrics are torn or very old, there should no need to throw them away. They will build up with fuzzballs over time and we have used this shaver on multiple occasions to do a perfect job of removing every single fuzzball so far. If you look at the two pictures of the before and after on the bedsheet, you will notice a huge difference. It's just a corner of the bedsheet and it took just a few minutes to remove basically most of the fuzzballs.<br /><br />One thing to note is that it will not pick up any hair or loose particles unless it's stuck to the fabric and is small/rounded enough to fit into the shaving head area. I actually have a small tear on the sheet and rolled over it with the shaver to see if it will snip it off. It just went by it without the blades cutting it. This is probably for the best since the purpose of this shaver it to remove fuzzballs.<br /><br />After you're done using the fabric shaver, I recommend just emptying the small container with all the shaved fabric. It's usually a simple cleaning but if it's a long or big job, there tends to be some additional fabric stuck where the blade is. I usually use a small set of tweezers and slowly pull them out from the bottom. You can also remove the face plate and try removing it there but I find it more effective removing from the bottom of the device.<br /><br />The shaver is pretty lightweight and operates on two AA batteries which are not included. I had this unit for over a year now and still haven't changed the battery yet. We don't use this frequently but when we do, especially on bigger jobs like bedsheets, it can be used for a good 15-20 minutes.<br /><br />PROS:<br />- light enough to carry in your travel bag to use when needed<br />- does an almost perfect job in every case with only one exception for me when one of my shirts was badly scuffed by a zipline harness I was wearing<br />- cleaning out the shaved fabrics is pretty straight forward and not too messy if you're careful<br /><br />CONS:<br />- fabrics tend to get stuck hear the spinning blade area when it's used for long/big jobs<br /><br />I was skeptical at first but after multiple uses and on bigger fabrics with more fuzzballs, I was amazed that this actually worked compared to other shavers I've used. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who hates fuzzballs and wants to remove them easily and effectively.<br /><br />If you find my review helpful, please click on the Yes button.g or big job, there tends to be some additional fabric stuck where the blade is. I usually use a small set of tweezers and slowly pull them out from the bottom. You can also remove the face plate and try removing it there but I find it more effective removing from the bottom of the device. The shaver is pretty lightweight and operates on two AA batteries which are not included. I had this unit for over a year now and still haven't changed the battery yet. We don't use this frequently but when we do, especially on bigger jobs like bedsheets, it can be used for a good 15-20 minutes. PROS: - light enough to carry in your travel bag to use when needed - does an almost perfect job in every case with only one exception for me when one of my shirts was badly scuffed by a zipline harness I was wearing - cleaning out the shaved fabrics is pretty straight forward and not too messy if you're careful CONS: - fabrics tend to get stuck hear the spinning blade area when it's used for long/big jobs I was skeptical at first but after multiple uses and on bigger fabrics with more fuzzballs, I was amazed that this actually worked compared to other shavers I've used. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who hates fuzzballs and wants to remove them easily and effectively. If you find my review helpful, please click on the Yes button.

  19. This thing is great! I've had it running for roughly 2 hrs now on the same set of batteries. So that's awesome. It's really easy to clean. Just pop it open and dump it out. The top screws off and you can tap out the fuzz that gets trapped.<br /><br />I've been using it on my hand-me-down couch. It has cat scratching damage on EVERY corner. The couch is microfiber suede, and I thought if I bought one of these deals it could make it look a little nicer. I've been really impressed with how it's been cleaning up the material. I posted the pictures because it's impossible to describe how fantastically this product worked. It took several passovers and some patience.<br /><br />I also tried it on a sweater and it worked amazingly there as well. It's not a new-looking sweater, but this took the wear off.<br /><br />No holes, no dead batteries, no hassle cleaning. Very nice product.
  20. Have the same one I bought years ago, blades stay sharp, easy to remove cover to clean. Works so well I have had my children request them for presents in Christmas stockings!
  21. Good product. Much less labour intensive than the manual scraper-style lint remover I have, and I didn't need to stretch the fabric much with the shaver, so it seemed much kinder on the garments.<br /><br />The process is naturally time consuming as the foil is only about an inch wide, but it worked a treat with only a few swipes back and forth over each area on cotton garments and even successfully on a Metalicus wrap (made out of pantyhose-like material) - even on this delicate material I didn't have issues with the fabric being snagged or damaged. The shaver did struggle on wool and I can't see it bringing up a wool garment 'as new' like it could on cotton with some patience - some of the lint bobbles on the wool seemed too large to fit in the foil's holes, and I think the blades struggled to cut through the heftier fibres, plus it occassionally got clogged on the wool - so I am still not sure on the best thing for wool.<br /><br />For delicates, far definitely better than the manual lint remover I have. I have not tried other brands of shavers to know how it compares to its competitors, but when this one dies I might try a larger sized unit like the Bobble Off as it seems to review similarly and perhaps this would save some time (presuming it works as well as this one of course!)
  22. the clear container falls off a lot while using it. Also it make some small holes on my thin cotton wraps. It's cheap, so I'll just keep it for thicker sweaters only.

It is easy to clean out and the lint shaving go neatly in it compartment. Great product.

  29. This product was not available on the UK version of amazon (or any other website at the time of writing this review) and having read many reviews on amazon.co.uk of all the other fabric shavers, they all seemed to be described as being of very poor quality and build. So I took a gamble and ordered the Remington one from the American Amazon site, resulting in having to pay as much for the delivery as for the product (i.e. double the quoted price in total). Do I have any regrets? Absolutely not. Delivery was within 3 DAYS. More significantly, this product has literally made many of my old jumpers and sweaters that I was about to throw away look almost brand new. I've only had it for about a month but so far so good. Absolutely fantastic in fact and I feel I've already made my 'money back' by virtue of all the bobbly (now almost brand new looking) woolen jumpers I was about to throw away. Very solid build, nice design and I hope it will last for many years. Strongly recommended.
  30. I got this because I have a few sweaters that look terrible with all of the pilling of the fabric. It's a slow process but if you take your time, the sweater comes out looking new! My only negative is the place that holds the cut pieces is so small that you have to stop and empty it a few times as you are working as it doesn't hold much. That's a small step in order to get a new looking sweater though. I would buy again.

  35. We ordered this Sunday, and here on Thursday, it was left in our mailbox. What we haven't tried. Lint tape, lint paper, bounce bars, anything and everything! The most expensive brand-name sweaters, we wash, and they turn into sweaters from the dollar store. Change detergents. Change washing machine. Until a family relative told us that there in Europe she uses a fabric shaver, we decided to buy a cheap one to test it. We were amazed! This item was the first to come up and everyone else gave it good reviews and it is true. I got it yesterday and did not want to put it down.   48. I wanted to like this because the fuzzbuster of my youth was a Remington, and it was great and lasted forever. And while this is a very effective fuzzbuster (blew my drugstore one out of the water), it has some major flaws that have sent me looking for a replacement, namely: - The holes in the cap are too big, making this a danger to delicate (and even not-so-delicate) fabrics. I made the mistake of fuzzbusting a delicately knit sweater and it chopped several holes in it (and I am very careful!). I also did a terrycloth jacket, and while it didn't chop holes, it DID nick it in several places, pulling threads out of place. - The supposedly ergonomic design is not so ergonomic. When cleaning fabric, I always hold the fabric in my left hand, with my hand beneath the area I'm cleaning, and then use my right hand to do the fuzzbusting. The only way this Remington would be ergonomic is if you held it in your hand at the angle shown in the picture. But to actually be effective, you need to hold it 90 degrees down from what the picture shows, meaning either the pointed end is in the palm of your hand or your wrist is awkwardly at 90 degrees. Not very comfortable. - My final complaint is the fuzz holder. It seems to have a smaller capacity than other small fuzzbusters I've used, and because of the so-called ergonomic design of the whole device, the hole from the blade area into the receptacle is small and narrow. So the fuzz ends up getting stuck in the blade area, and you have to remove the cap, remove the blades, and clear it out. Also, the fuzz that does manage to get into the container gets stuck in the plastic seam, which isn't sealed, but also isn't removable. What a pain! In short, I wouldn't recommend buying this. Find a traditionally-shaped fuzzbuster with smaller holes in the cap...that's what I'm looking for.
  49. I get a lot of fabric pills on my sheets and never heard of a fabric shaver. After searching for something, I bought this and it works flawlessly. You can hear the unit pick up all the annoying pills, what a great sound. Now I can use my sheets without irritation.
  50. Works just as it claims. Perfect for that hoodie you love with the piling on it or a sweater you've worn many times.   130. I received this handy little device for Christmas this year, and what a fantastic tool! I immediately tried it on my worst pilly sweater. It took a little while to get it clean, but the difference was night and day! My sweater looks brand new! I had to stop the shaver three separate times to remove all the lint it was collecting, but with the removable compartment and the screw-off head and removable blades, cleaning it is no problem. The shaver is very gentle on my most delicate fabrics while being incredibly effective at removing lint and pills. I highly recommend this product to anyone who owns sweaters, corduroy pants, blankets, or anything that gets pilly after a few washes.

The problem is that one set of two AA batteries is only enough to shave the front OR back of one women's medium sweater. I've stopped using it because I can't justify buying four batteries every time I need to get the lint off just one sweater. I would only recommend it to someone who has rechargeable batteries at home otherwise it's just too expensive to operate.
  147. I literally pulled three perfectly good but dreadfully pilled sweaters out of the trash in order to test this little guy. I now have at least one more season's wear out of all three sweaters. Yay! To all you pilled-sweater fellas and gals out there: Please pay attention to the instructions not to apply any pressure while using the device, and let the motor and blades do the work. I did nick one sweater slightly (fortunately it was in an inconspicuous spot, and I was able to darn the hole). The $5.99 price is definitely right: It would have cost me close to $200.00 to replace the three sweaters with similar merchandise. The reasons I hold back from a 5-star rating are that the fuzz-collection compartment is liable to come loose while the shaver is in use; it's sometimes necessary to use fine-tipped tweezers to extract fuzz from the blades; and there is a generally dinky feeling to the product. But even if the fabric shaver doesn't last another week, I figure that at about two bucks a pop I have three sweaters back in play. Yay again!

  262. After having this item for a little over a month, I came up with a conclusion for this product.<br /><br />Pro: Takes all the pills off of any fabric you could think of, and quickly too! You only have to go over it once, MAYBE twice to remove everything.<br /><br />Con: Battery doesn't last that long. Additionally, put two holes in my burnout t-shirts because I wasn't careful. :(<br /><br />Tips: Be VERY light (especially on thin fabrics!!!) There is no need to press hard, it will still remove it. Use circular motions on area as well. I found that removing the pills from the compartment after doing a section (a sleeve, the back side of the shirt, the front side of the shirt) before you move onto a different section works well and keeps the machine functional.<br /><br />Despite two holes being in my shirts, I would still recommend this product. You just have to be extremely careful when doing thin fabrics and you should be fine.

  271. This works so well! I have de-fuzzed all my sweaters, my northface, even my winter hat! Easy and quick to use-love it!
  272. After some surfing on Amazon and reading some reviews, I bought this Remington fabric shaver. In summary, the Remington fabric shaver is inexpensive, does the job (but proceed with caution), and has a fairly sturdy build.<br /><br />Here are my experiences:<br /><br />- I really like how heavy it feels in my hand. It's good to have a device that's nice in the hand and wouldn't slip out suddenly.<br /><br />- It looks great. The blue is a nice touch and the transparent fabric shavings holder helps to give me a good idea of when to toss out the trash.<br /><br />- The transparent shavings holder has a section that collects all the shavings. Most of the time, the shavings do not fall out when opening to toss out. It's a wonderful little detail that can help prevent many times when you'd have to bend down to clean up the mess.<br /><br />- The bigger holes in the steel shaving cover allows the lint, etc to collect better.<br /><br />- In terms of performance, my sweaters, socks, and lint on my clothes have virtually vanished.<br /><br />There are more expensive, bigger and stronger fabric shavers, but this Remington fabric shaver is inexpensive and does the job. If well taken care of, this fabric shaver will last a while. If not and even over time, the fabric shaver will eventually be of no use. Still, given the price and performance, it's a must buy for anyone that has lint and fabric problems. Buy with confidence!<br /><br />P.S. Be careful how much pressure you apply to your clothing/fabric. Make sure the intended area is flat, so that no drapes get stuck in the blade. With any fabric shaver, there is a potential for holes and damage, especially if not handled carefully.
  273. It performs perfectly!!!!!

  275. Less embarrassing too when I wore them out since my coats look much nicer without the balls. It won't make your old jacket/coats look like new, it would be a false hope! No other product will make your old clothes look new, but this little fabric shaver can make it look so much nicer. I highly recommend this product to someone or my friends if they have favorite coats that suffer from these fabric balls after wearing.<br /><br />This Fabric Shaver is hand size and very easy to use. It has protective cover so you don't need to worry about accidentally cutting fingers or hurt yourself. It requires two AA batteries to operate. Also it is very easy to empty the fabrics from the compartment that holds them, though the compartment is very small (make sense cuz the product is small) so I need to empty it twice when I shaved a knee-long coat. This little shaver probably works best for coats and jackets and not for very thin shirts though as other reviews said it may cut a hole in thin fabrics if you are not careful.<br /><br />All in all, I love this fabric shaver, and highly recommend it.

  292. This fabric shaver truly does remove pills. I haven't had it remove part of fabric I've been working on, but it has managed to remove a small portion of the top layer of skin on a finger. It was my own fault for playing with it, but I haven't experienced that with other models. It didn't bleed, but did remove skin. The real problems with it are that it pulverizes what it removes and then you're left with removing that from whatever your fabric has been resting on. And the container for collecting pills is difficult for the pills to enter. Besides that, the container is so small that you're always thinking about emptying it. Unclogging the point between the shaver and the \\"bin\\" is also frustrating. And at times, it seems to loosen from the shaver, which is disappointing. But it sure does remove pills. So I graduated to a \\"big one\\" and that works really well, better than anything I've used. Expensive, but apparently the only way to get a shaver that actually functions well without important drawbacks.

  300. I was hesitant to buy this because most people loved it and some people hated it because it ruined clothing. I didn't want to take that chance but I'm glad I did!!! I've used this on two cotton tees, two North Face hoodies and my North Face Denali jacket so far. It does not make the article of clothing look new....used clothing is used clothing BUT it does get rid of the pesky lint balls and changes the appearance dramatically.<br /><br />We have all been there and pulled at something we shouldn't have (usually light knits, woven linens) it just made it worse...DO NOT use this device for those types of clothing. If you're worried about clothing being ruined if you pull the knots/balls by hand, don't use an electric device to do it for you.<br /><br />This device works just like men's shaver: there are cycling blades inside that shave the material sticking up. If the blades stop rotating, screw off the cover and use a pair of tweezers to clean out the inside. The blades act as a fan and fans the lint balls into the collection chamber but if there is too much in the collection chamber or a long thread is tangled in the blades, they will stop rotating. It doesn't mean it's broken, just clean it out.<br /><br />With the few articles of clothing I've used this on, it's already paid for itself. I'm just disappointed that I didn't buy this sooner! Don't let the negative reviews get you down....try it!

  338. So I purchased two different products in order to compare. Straight out of the package with a fresh pair of batteries installed, the thing worked for one second. I kid you not. I thought the batteries were bad or not tight. I readjusted them. Once again, it worked for one second. I can't even test how well it would shave fuzz balls because it won't work for more than one second. In contrast, the [[ASIN:B000WUXOT2 Sweater Stone]] worked perfectly and is amazingly gentle. It quite obviously did not harm the fibers but took off the pills. You don't need batteries and it won't wear out. This thing is going back even though it will cost me at least half as much as the refund I will get. I am so tired of companies not having the minimal integrity it takes to produce something that doesn't rip off the customer and the environment. We need minus star options for reviews. This would be a minus five star.
  339. Completely restored three $200+ sweaters to like new upon my first use!! I often get pills on my cardigans due to carrying a purse that has fabric that rubs - this is genius. Just put the sweater on top of my dresser and glided the fabric shaver along, not putting pressure on it as per the instructions. Works like a charm!
  340. I can't believe I paid less than ten bucks for this thing - I absolutely LOVE what it does! What a great concept! I took my black light and shone it on my sofa after all the lights were turned out, and wow - what a lot of little pills & fuzzies that showed up glowing bright white under the ultra-violet light! Then I took this Remington Fabric Shaver and shaved 'em all right off! Granted it took me about 10 minutes per cushion, and the blades did jam about every 1-2 minutes, so I had to unscrew the top of it and blow to get the fuzzies to get down into the clear part of the shaver. But overall this is an amazing instrument, and I still can't believe how reasonably it's priced! I've only had it a day, so I hope it does last as long as it's supposed to.
  341. This product does wonders in the way that it makes an old sweater look new. It can be time consuming depending on how much balls are on the sweater but it is definitely worth the price.

Works like a charm -- de-pilled a nice expensive wool sweater with ease and for a very low cost.

  350. I had an old Remington lint shaver that lasted for about 20 years and worked flawlessly until it finally died. This replacement does shave lint. But then the problems start. Most of the lint does not fall into the reservoir, but gets trapped under the blades, so then I have to open the cover, remove the blades and manually clear out the lint. Also, lint comes out the front, since it's trapped. I tried shaking the shaver every so often, to try to get the lint to fall into the reservoir, with limited success. Do not be tempted by the \\"ergonomic\\" design. Both the lint reservoir and the batter cover come out too easily as you are shaving.

Fuzz catches underneath blades too often due to buildup of pieces that aren't able to go into storage compartment.   410. It's been a while since I've had access to one of these guys. My stepmother had one when I was a kid, and I always thought it was a lot of fun to shave my clothes... or the sheets... or even pillows. And, all I remember thinking was that I wanted one when I grew up.<br /><br />Well, now I'm all \\"grown up\\".. and I finally have my own fabric shaver. This little guy is fantastic. It's actually better than the one I used as a kid. It shaves a lot faster, and closer, than the old one did. But, the main thing I love about it is that it's so easy to clean. Just pop off the back, and empty it. (It's like one of those bagless vacuums.) Another thing that makes this shaver easy to clean is that the cap screws off. So, if you notice that there's a ball of fuzz stuck by the little blades, you can pop off the cap and pull it out. (Just, be careful of the blades. They're sharp little buggers.)<br /><br />All in all, I highly recommend this product to anyone looking to get rid of those annoying little pills that like to appear on sweaters, jeans, sheets... or anything else you might need it for. Happy fabric shaving!

It's true that the tiny inexpensive motor like the one in this model has limitations, and it's wise to only use it for say, 20 min at a time. That's just common sense. I read you should also keep emptying the lint as you go, I think that's a good idea to help it last longer. I bought 3, one to replace the one that croaked, and 2 for friends who asked \\"help me maintain my sweaters, yours always look good year after year\\" So far, all three of us have no complaints. I have read some reviews that warn that the shaver will \\"suck\\" loose fibers into it, and tear a hole in some sweaters. Again, that's just common sense. Of course you should be extra careful in areas with loose fibers. maybe you should darn/sew those areas back together before trying to shave the surface. I have already done approx. 4 sweaters, 1 scarf, 2 gloves, and 1 wool coat this month. Everything looks like new, like when I saw it on the hanger in the shop. I'm happy.

  455. Used it from the first day I got it and it worked great - until the grill broke recently. I hate to do that because the grill is the only thing wrong with it & with the grill this flimsy I could be spending $6 every month or so! I'd bought an Oreck because it had a bigger head than this Remington & I had some projects that were tedious but the Oreck turned out to be useless & a waste of time & money because it just didn't pick up any of the pills (on any fabric) like it should & I did return it & got my full refund. I had to go back over the fabrics with the Remington anyway & got the result I wanted. This Remington does pick up pills, gets a very smooth shave, & makes items look new. However, the user should be careful to pay attention. I put some holes in my clothing, usually because I wasn't paying attention. Sometimes, even when I was paying attention, I got holes. All things considered, that's a risk I'm willing to take. The collection thing doesn't hold as tight as it did when I first got it, but it does decently enough.
  456. This shaver works great on regular to heavyweight material, but is way TOO POWERFUL on lightweight stuff. It sucked my summer knit tunic in and created a hole before I could react. Thinking this was a fluke (or I was an idiot) and being more cautious, I wrapped my next lightweight shirt snugly around my ironing board and carefully started near the hem. Within seconds it too was sucked in and another hole was left behind. I've used these types of shavers for years, so I'm not a newbie to how they work. This one is just a lot more powerful, and the face holes are a bunch bigger, when I compared it with my older shavers. Since the face unscrews to allow for better clean-out, it would be great if Remington offered a smaller-holed replaceable face for lightweight material.

  464. Practice makes perfect. Several users complained about damaging fabric. It takes a light touch to use any shaver properly. I've had others; this one is really good. I either use with item on or pulled over my thigh to have fabric smooth, nearly taught, then shave with circular motion, checking blades occaionally for any lint to be removed. Highly recommended.
  465. It only got clogged up once, works as advertised. The only snag I ran into is that with one of my thinner sweaters, when removing pilling it actually caused a few holes in the material. That was disappointing.
  466. This Fabric shaver works amazing. I purchased this unit actually to remove pills from my vehicle's suede inserts on the seats. It didn't damage the material at all and worked quickly. Plus it was easy to use and uses regular batteries.   469. I bought this a few years ago and it worked pretty great until it suddenly stopped working for no apparent reason. I figured I got a nice long life out of it before it needed replacing, so I went ahead and got another. It won't last forever, but try to take good care of it.<br /><br />Also, be careful with clothing. Make sure everything is flat, or else you might accidentally hit a crease and cut a hole in your fabric. It's not common if you're careful, but use it properly! I find that for pants, it's best to use it WHILE you're wearing the garment.

  533. I purchased this fabric shaver after some of my dress shirts (The kind of work, weddings, etc) started to develop a ton of little lint balls on them. They were starting to get so bad my options were to try a fabric shaver or just donate the shirts to good will. The shaver is easy to use, and it had no issues at all. After one use the shirt I tried this on is smooth and looks almost brand new now. The one downside to these is that as small as they are, it can take an eternity to cleanup just one article of clothing.   534. This lint remover is amazing. It takes off pills/lint with ease, making my sweaters and shirts look like new. I even was able to use it on a couple of ties as the stitching on the pattern began to come loose.<br /><br />There is ONE big issue that you must know about, because if you are careful it won't be a problem at all. The shaver tends to get fabric caught in it from time to time, especially on clothing with rougher textures. If you just move it all around on this piece of clothing you're trying to shave and apply a lot of pressure, threads are bound to get caught and pulled out. It's bound to happen every so often, and you can use the shaver to go over the spot and take down any new loose threads you've created, but if you aren't careful this will happen a lot and you will probably end up ruining your shirt. Just move it slowly and gently, without pressing too hard, and you'll be fine.<br /><br />Otherwise, this is a perfectly good product that will bring your old clothes back to life. I would definitely recommend it, just remember to be careful and you'll be all set.
  535. I thought at first that the product wasn't working but you just have to be patient and go over your clothing several times (slowly) before seeing results but it's worth it. I also used it on a thin, cotton shirt and I didn't have any problem with it creating holes. For the price, a great value.

  606. It works ok. I had one in the past, can't remember if it was this brand or not. But my old one worked better, the holes in the metal top were a little bigger, so the fabric balls could get inside and be cut off. This one cut a few of them, but leaves most behind.
  607. Has saved a ton of my sweaters from looking tired and worn out. Refreshed them really nicely. Didn't ruin the fabric at all like some users complained. Gave me a few of my favorites back! Wish I had discovered this a long time ago.
  608. I had lint pills on my pants and blankets and the scratchy texture was slowly annoying me out of my mind. I foolishly got lint rollers as I initially thought that was how you remove lint pills. Upon consulting the Google however I found out about fabric shavers. However I am extremely glad I did. This thing is (without overstating) one of the best purchases I made.<br /><br />When reading the reviews I was hesitant on getting this as I didn't want a gaping hole in my clothes/bedding. Upon receiving it I immediately removed all the annoying lint pills on my pants and blanket. Even applying pressure on them it did not end up with a hole in my pants and blanket. What did result though was an extremely smooth and soft fabric (and I mean baby soft). I am extremely glad I bought this.
  609. This is simply an amazing product. Couldn't be happier with this. Just throw a few batteries in it, turn it on, and those lint balls on your sweatshirts, etc. are gone. Would recommend since it is priced great!

  615. This fabric shaver makes great work of fleece clothing in particular, and I was pleased to have some of my clothing renewed. However, the metal used to make the shaver head is extremely fine, and a section of mine broke off with the pressure of using the device, within a very short time. It still works, but I have to be extremely careful not to snag clothing on the sharp edge where the metal broke. I would not buy this again. I have heard that Brookstone produced a similar product that holds up much better, but I don't know if they are still making it. I'm a little wary of buying another.

If you have an expensive garment, be careful. The blades are sharp, but with lots of use, they obviously dull and can lightly pull on the material. I haven't had any problems, but with kashmir it might be something to use initially, but not forever.<br /><br />I would HIGHLY recommend this for the removal of all things fuzzy on your clothes!<br /><br />I plan on buying another one as a backup.

  637. Following reviewing the various &#34;pill&#34; removers on Amazon I settled on this one. I am very glad this was the one I chose. I primarily decided on the Remington because of price and the overall pretty good reviews. I was skeptical of it operating on 2 AA batteries as I generally find battery operated devices to be poor quality. Not true with this. Plenty of power and longevity of operation. I primarily use it to remove pills from bedding/sheets and it works excellently if you use it as directed----just make sure you keep the discharge vessel cleaned out thoroughly and remove the cover to remove any shorn fabric that will likely start to tangle the spindle. I've found that if I do this, again, as directed, it works great!!!

  643. This shaver is one of those items you would probably never buy on your own, but you are so grateful for it when it comes in your life. I had a ton of sweaters with fuzzy, irritating lint balls and I was about ready to throw them out. As a last stitched effort, I ordered the shaver and am so glad I did. All my sweaters look new. I've used it on thin, cotton shirts to heavy wool jackets - it works on anything I try! Even upholstered items and pillows are no match for the Remington shaver. I love it so much, I bought three more for gifts. And, at the job's White Elephant party, it was a sought after item, lol. Some user tips I'd offer: frequent cleanings are necessary to keep it running efficiently, be sure to unscrew the screen and clean blades (don't cut yourself), don't press the shaver to the garment-hover over it, and enjoy! As a couple of posters mentioned, it is enjoyable, in a weird way. Great purchase, indeed.
  644. I'm a guy that actually bought this for all my dozen plus pairs of smart wool socks that are all pilled up. took my time and used this handy dandy pill eater and my socks are like brand new. This little thing is a beast.
  645. I was concerned based on reviews that this would be a dud. It definitely didn't return sweaters to like-new condition, but it really did improve the appearance with a bit of babying it around. It's not ideal, but under ten bucks to restore quite a few sweaters to much better condition is well worth it - it's only a bit more than the cost of dry-cleaning!<br /><br />Three downsides of note:<br />- Only takes primary (non-rechargeable) AA batteries. Minor point, but I didn't have any lying around.<br />- The reservoir fills relatively quickly and has to be emptied regularly, pretty much once a garment.<br />- Be careful. It's not a high quality piece of equipment. You can bend the metal faceplate and prevent it from working relatively easily. Also, see the other reviews about it catching on a loose thread or bunched up fabric and tearing holes.<br /><br />A bit of care and babying can prevent all these downsides, so overall, I'd say it's worth your while.
  646. The unit keeps battery power well and is a good solution for minor pilling on knitwear. It quickly and smoothly takes the pilling off without snagging or damaging the knit. If the garment it extremely pilled or you need to do a large item this is not a good solution in that it would take far too long to do. That is a job better left for the dry cleaner or a sweater stone.<br /><br />This is something that anyone that owns knits should have.
  647. The plastic fuzz collector broke with in minutes of it coming out of the box. It is now a pain in the butt to try and use because it keeps falling off every 3 seconds. It functions ok. I don't recommend it for very thick woven sweaters, either. It works best on fine woven wool sweaters.
  648. This shaver MIGHT work for very, very light sweater, but for anything else, it is completely useless.   649. This is a travel size item and is very tiny compared to what I'm used to. Since it is so tiny, it takes much longer to shave something with a large surface area, like a jacket.<br /><br />I am also very disappointed in its performance. It is absolutely brutal on knit fabrics, even something as sturdy as athletic socks. It seems to suck the fabric into itself and rip the fibers. I ruined a pair of socks and a blanket. I have to clean up a mess of lint after using it. It spews it about during use and it is impossible to empty the reservoir after using it without a mess.<br /><br />I do not think this is a good product and I would recommend trying something else.<br /><br />Update: I found a small piece of metal on my floor that I didn't recognize until I picked up my shaver to try to use it again and saw a large hole in the screen. I have not mishandled this item so I don't know how it broke but the shaver is in the garbage now. It's amazing to me that something I had bought almost forty years ago lasted so long and this shaver only lasted through several uses (or should I say \\"abuses\\").

I'v had pretty much waaay too much fun 'shaving' all my sweaters (I really like sweaters). The directions included address the issue about fabric type, etc.. So I'm not totally sure why some reviewers are having issues with damaging their clothing. I've used this on a variety of knits/fabrics, and while a bit more care is needed when using this shaver on raised details (such as cabling), or thinner fabrics, I never felt as though I were in danger of damaging the fabric.<br /><br />I did have an incident when I nicked one of the yarn threads on a knit sweater, and had to patch/reinforce that spot to prevent unraveling, just using a bit of hand threading. But that's just because I was being a bit overzealous. The directions say not to push down, and to simply allow the pressure to come from the weight of the device (to prevent damage), and I wasn't doing that.. again, it all comes back to following the directions.<br /><br />So, yeah, it does exactly what it advertises.

  802. I ordered this sweater shaver after years of not getting one for fear of it destroying clothing.   803. I don't want to rehash all the great reviews out there by trying to give the same information. I want to focus on saving $$$$ with an item like this.<br /><br />I've already read the reviews about how this shaver extends the life of clothing by making it look new again, thereby allowing you to get more years out of your current clothing and thus saving money. I couldn't agree more. I keep getting new life out of my sweaters every season with just a little help from this gadget. Obvious money saver.<br /><br />But I can think of 3 additional ways this has saved me money:<br /><br />Thrift store shopping: I can buy items that have fabric pills on them (that no one else would buy, and that have made it to clearance) and make them look fantastic. So I save money by purchasing clothing at thrift stores that can still be &#34;redeemed&#34; from the ash heap of used clothing. Cha-ching!<br /><br />I can buy &#34;lesser brands&#34; in some cases at retail stores, and this shaver keeps the clothing looking as good as the high end name brands. SAVINGS! For example, I bought my 7 year old several pairs of store brand athletic pants made of 100% polyester. From constant wear, they started to get &#34;boogered up&#34;, as my husband would say. My 7 year old also has a high end, name brand hoodie made out of the same fabric. Because it's higher quality, though, it hasn't pilled yet. It's still as smooth as glass. When I pulled out my shaver on the pants, I cleaned them up in no time, they were as smooth as a silk, and they looked just as new as the name brand hoodie. Pre-shaving, they looked like something you'd buy at a thrift store...you know, like the kind I mentioned above that no one else would buy. Unless they knew about this little miracle.<br /><br />Finally, when the kiddos outgrow clothing, I can make some items look new again if they're not stained or otherwise damaged. Take the shaver for a quick spin over the clothing (like the pants mentioned above) and they can easily be sold on ebay.<br /><br />There you have it. For all you frugal folks, the investment in this shaver is nothing compared to the $$$ it can save.

Using this guy, they're like new. It's quick and thorough. Two things to note: - I do wish it were bigger. It takes quite some time to completely shave a top.   832. After reading other reviews, I was wary of using this product, but given Amazon's great return policy & the low price, I thought I'd give it a try. In my experience it works great for removing pills/balls from sweaters, hats, gloves, & other knits. I was afraid that the razors might cut holes in my favorite sweaters - if you're scared at first, I'd recommend that you try it on an older sweater or a pair of socks/gloves first. I've used it with great results on fine-gauge cashmere and wool sweaters. I will say that cable knits & chunkier/open-weave designs are trickier because it's more likely that you'll accidentally shave off a piece of yarn instead of a pill. You do have to empty the fuzz catching compartment after 1-3 sweaters, depending on the condition of the sweater & the type of fabric (it filled up after 1 heavy wool sweater with lots of pilling, and again after 2 fine-gauge cashmere sweaters). Overall I'd recommend this product!
  833. This little shaver works great to remove small to large fuzzballs from clothes and makes them look almost new. I was surprised at its power and ability to avoid \\"stalls\\" on heavy fuzz. Only minor issue is that when used vertically with the shaver head down (as when clothes lie flat on a table), lint will back up in the head and is a little hard to get out, but not that hard if you take the head off. Used horizontally or head up and the lint goes into the lint reservoir as it should. Highly recommended !
  834. I have a couch and chair that \\"pill\\" every few months and this device does a great job trimming those. You just run it over the fabric a few times and it shaves off the threads that have balled up. The shavings are trapped inside a little compartment and you pull that off to empty it. It's very handy.
  835. This was an impulse buy--I was searching for ways to de-pill clothing and found this link and bought it right away because of the cheap price. I figured if it was a dud, it wasn't much money lost. I was more than surprised by the quality of this item. It works PERFECTLY. It's lightweight and easy to use, and best of all, it makes my fuzzy sweaters look like new. My friend had given me a sweater that I knew she didn't want because it was looking a little ratty... less than five minutes with the Fabric Shaver and the sweater looks brand new--my friend's loss! I've tried it out on old pants, even a pair of underwear that had pilled in the dryer. There is no damage to the fabric at all. I don't know how it works, it just does! The clear part that holds the shavings is easy to remove, but one tip: empty it before it gets full. Depending on the type of fabric you are de-fuzzing, it can back up quickly and clog the blades at the top. Fortunately, even the head can be removed and replaced easily, so cleaning it out wasn't a problem. I love this purchase and recommend it to anyone--we've all got fuzzies that need to be gone somewhere.
  836. I purchased this to get pills of of a non-wool pea coat that I own. It worked wonders on it. It doesn't have a ton of power, and I'm glad it doesn't since it would probably tear up my clothes if it did.   837. I absolutely love this thing. I bought two. I have \\"shaved\\" my favorite dark red sweater so that now I can actually wear it out in public again. Honest to goodness it was worth the price just to save that one sweater and I have others. I particularly like the fact that this little magic shaver has larger holes in the head as I think another reviewer mentioned and that allows it to gather more of the fuzzy stuff and pills. It also has a separate compartment to collect and dispose of the lint unlike the old ones which you just opened up and it fell out. This one is separate and you dump it out where you want it to go. I highly recommend this little \\"magic shaver.\\"

  859. I bought this because it had the highest ratings, but was worried about the hole issue that some people experienced. Well I used it today on a rayon sweater that is pretty thin, and didn't experience the hole-making problem that others had. I think the reason people got holes using this product is if they pushed too forcefully when using this to shave off lint. The best thing to do is to lightly and quickly run this shaver over the clothing and just make multiple passes to get the lint off. It works well and was worth the money.

The lint chamber is small and needs to be emptied frequently--instructions say it should not ever be more than 3/4 full. It's easy to empty. The head also unscrews, the blade comes out, and you can clean the build-up on the inside of the head.
  913. After reading the other reviews here, I was a little wary that using this fabric shaver would leave a hole in my garment. But, I ventured ahead using it on my Ralph Lauren Black Label Angora Sweater anyway.<br /><br />It is a very powerful shaver with a decent amount of suction. The key is to not let the shaver touch the fabric. Keep it one half inch or so away and it should still grip the pilled knots without sucking in the healthy fabric. Again, a little caution and patience is key. But it was very easy to use and made my sweater look like new again. It has an easy access battery compartment and fabric collector.<br /><br />Very good purchase for the money. I hope this item lasts me for years. It is travel size but who travels with a fabric shaver? People who wear a lot more wool than me? I'm really not sure who would take this on a plane. Anyway, don't store the batteries in it, and I think it should last a long time.

  965. First, the good news:<br /><br />- Inexpensive, as I purchased as an Amazon Prime Add-on product.<br />- Remington is a known and trusted name, so I knew it and trusted it.<br />- It revived the garments I tried first (pet hoodies, of all things) BRILLIANTLY.<br />- Probably the most effective pill remover I've ever tried.<br /><br />Some reviewers complained of fabric shredding pulling issues and such. I had no similar experiences, and I believe if you take care to exercise common sense when using this (ie., pulling cloth taut, type of material upon which you choose to use it, not treating it like a hedge trimmer and hacking at the garment) you, too, will not suffer any damage from using this on your good clothing.<br /><br />Now, the bad:<br />- It's made like junk.<br />- The On/Off switch moves from On to Off, but this seems to be purely for my entertainment because it never actually shuts the motor. Maybe it's just my unit that's flawed, maybe it's pandemic; but certainly, it's a pain.<br />- The battery compartment, once you open it, does not want to stay closed. And I mean when it's empty of batteries because...<br />- THE BATTERY COMPARTMENT COVER DOESN'T FIT WHEN IT'S GOT BATTERIES IN IT.<br />- I had to insert the batteries, leave the cover off, and operate it looking half-built and half-brained. But this didn't make it any worse to use except aesthetically. The batteries stayed in place throughout the process.<br />- But the batteries CAN'T stay in because as I stated above, THE ON/OFF SWITCH IS GLITCHED so the only way to turn the unit OFF is to remove the juice.<br />- This is how I learned the compartment door won't go back on after the batteries are again removed. It just seems that it was made to fit to show all pretty in the package, but once it's been jimmied open, it's just misshapen enough to not fit back where it should be.<br /><br />So now I have a ziplock bag with the unit, the batteries, and the battery compartment door stored together, but disassembled out of necessity.<br /><br />But when I DO assemble it and use it, THE PERFORMANCE ON THIS POORLY MADE UNIT IS UNEQUALED.<br /><br />&#34;Buyer Beware&#34; is more a case of &#34;Buyer Be Aware&#34; because if you don't mind the extra fuss, the results are worth the trouble.disassembled out of necessity.<br /><br />But when I DO assemble it and use it, THE PERFORMANCE ON THIS POORLY MADE UNIT IS UNEQUALED.<br /><br />&#34;Buyer Beware&#34; is more a case of &#34;Buyer Be Aware&#34; because if you don't mind the extra fuss, the results are worth the trouble.

Gently press on and just swirl it around and it takes off almost all the fuzzies off.<br />I would DEFINITELY recommend this to everyone!

  983. its a good one. it cleans almost my all dirty clothes.
  984. I have to say, this product DOES do what it's supposed to do, which is shave the clothing and get rid of pills on the fabric. However, be warned that it will frequently and unexpectedly put holes in your clothes. I used to use my mom's clothes shaver and never had this problem...maybe the holes on this one are too big, or it is too powerful? I blamed it on myself at first for not being careful enough or not laying the clothes flat enough. But when my mom, who is very careful with these things, also put a hole in my shirt with it, I knew it was the fault of the product. I would not recommend buying it...the money you save by getting this one will not be worth it with the amount of clothes you will ruin.
  985. I've been shopping on Amazon (a lot) since the early 90s and this may be my favorite purchase. It does exactly what it is supposed to do and does it well. I can't account for some of the poorer reviews on here. It's really a great product and the price is a steal.
  986. As stupid as it may seem, I consider 4 star products to be a risk. Despite the fact that this fabric shaver is very cheap, it took me several weeks of consideration before I finally decided to buy it. I could not be more impressed.<br /><br />It's extremely easy to operate; you just gently rub it over your fabrics. I had a few jackets with a ton of lint balls/pills, and this thing made them look brand new. Don't push too hard, you will probably damage the fabric. When I'm using it, I just barely let it touch the surface of the fabric. It works perfectly, and it collects a ton of lint. I even decided to run it over the lower back of some of my polos (a typical place for pills to accumulate) and it worked great. I've used it on a ton of my clothes (and my girlfriend's clothes) and the batteries haven't died yet.<br /><br />Overall, just give it a go if you're on the fence. It worked wonders for me. I'm driving my roommates mad bragging about how good it is and using it on every fabric I can find.
  987. This battery-operated lint remover works very well. Purrs and looks like a vibrator sex toy, but don't be confused, it's a lint ball remover from clothing. I read other reviews about it leaving holes, and I can see how that might happen if you pressed too hard as the metal shield is flexible. However, there is really no pressure required if you glide the shaver (I found doing it in circles helped too) there are no problems so far!   1403. This is a heavy duty unit as far as fabric shavers go. It's important that you recognize that before deciding to purchase this. If you aren't careful or push too hard, there's a good chance you're going to cut the fabric itself. That's the tradeoff you make for something that's going to clear pills from your fabric at an incredible pace and there's just no way around it. Awesome product all around.

  1408. I've been using this shaver for over a year now, and going strong. I purchased it from Amazon in August 2011 (under a different account, which is why it does not show up as a verified purchase here). At the time, it was sold by Amazon, for $5.99, and was eligible for Prime. All of that aside, I've used it quite a bit and haven't had any problems with it. I was skeptical, but it actually does the job. I've used it on many different fabrics, including delicates, and have not encountered any problems with shaving the fabrics. Note, though, that if your material is VERY thin (such as lingerie) it will work but you must be VERY careful to hold the fabric taut, or it will get sucked up resulting in a smal snag or hole. On these fabrics, hold them taut, go slow and don't press down hard - it will work. The plastic lint trap does seem to come off too easily sometimes - a wrong touch, and it pops off. I just snap it back on and continue, but do feel like this could be improved upon. It takes two AA batteries, which seem to have a good lifespan. It's small, light, and fits comfortably in my hand. Overall length is just under 5 inches. The shaving head is about 1 1/2 inches in diameter (size of a dollar coin maybe?), so if you've got a larger area / item to shave, it does take some patience (use it while you're watching TV, or waiting at your kid's practice / lesson or whatever) ... but it works! Depending upon how bad your garment is, you might want to have a trash can nearby to empty the lint trap often. It definitely extends the life of your clothes ... would recommend.
  1409. It does not actually take most of the little pills off of a sweater, but I suppose better than nothing.

It just makes everything look so nice and new all over again!

  1452. Small and light weight, fits easily in the hand, have used it so far on a few articles of clothing, works as advertised. I used it (carefully) on a sweater, and it smoothed the surface to look like new. The only thing I noticed negative (hence the 4/5 stars) is that when I used it on the sweater, because there was a lot of fuzz, the fuzzies all attracted each other and clumped around the blades. Only a little bit made it down into the clear pocket. The blades got congested so that they started making noise. When I cleared the blades out, the shaver worked as normal again. This item would be 5/5 stars if the air was strong enough to circulate and \\"force\\" the fuzzies down into the clear pocket. (Or, \\"up\\", I should say, since when the shaver is used, the blade is normally faced down on the article of clothing, and the pocket is up.)

  1527. I used to have a much larger type of fabric shaver that worked very well. I decided to get a replacement. I did not think this would be as small as it was. It could literally fit in the palm of our hand. However, the small size is very convenient for traveling and I do think it works very well for its purpose. The only complaint that I have is that the mesh material is very flimsy, a little stronger than heavy duty aluminum foil. I had the blade get caught up once and the mesh cracked on the second use. Amazon CS was very great to work with and gave me a full refund. I would order again but be very cautious on how hard I am pressing down on my garments.

  1530. This device has a couple small flaws, but once you get used to them you seem to be able to deal with them okay. Firstly, both the battery compartment lid and the little lint storage compartment keep sliding off the body of the shaver. The snap locking tabs are inadequate and could use some beefing up. And secondly, if you hold the shaver face down, the lint will build up in the cutting area and may ball up inside. I had to clear this area with a bent paper clip a couple of times. Other than these somewhat annoying problems, the device works well and is probably worth its small cost.

  1603. My Remington Battery Operated Fabric Shaver arrived today. Before I forget, batteries don't come with the shaver so have 2 AA on hand. First went over a pair of socks that always seem to come out of the dryer with nubbies all over them. Nubbies gone in the blink of an eye. This is a small machine so be prepared for that. You'll be able to get stuff off your clothes every other shaver you've had left on. At least that's the case for me. My last fuzz buster died a few months ago so had some \\"busting\\" to do. I've removed lint, nubbies, fuzz off a shawl I had, pills on cushions where legs rub the fabric...and they'll be more. Ok, Ease of use and quality of performance: A+. Down side is you'll have to empty the cup more often because it IS small. Not such a bad deal though because this shaver is very easy to open. It's a breeze to empty the lint cup or take the cap off the blades and take the blades out once in a while to really get all the lint completely out. So, ease of cleaning this shaver: A+. Cost...a no brainer...cheap. Longevity..????..who knows.<br /><br />Update December 12th: There is a cap over the blades that is made of a very thin laced metal. Perfect holes for shaving everything by the way. Maybe there was a little crack in mine...not sure. I know it wasn't because of too much pressure on my part because I'm very careful with it. In any event I heard a crunch sound. Next thing I know I've got a small jagged hole in the blade cover. I'm going to buy another one as soon as I get my refund and give it one more try. This is just too perfect of a fuzz buster to give up after one mishap which could have just been a manufacturing defect. Return is easy. Just pack it up, print out a pre-paid return label, I include a copy of my invoice and off it goes back to Amazon. My refund should be quick once they get it back. Over the years I haven't returned many items but it's always been a flawless experience.

  1637. I have been impressed by how much stuff this little shaver can actually pick up. It dramatically improves the looks of most any fabric but just be careful not to press too hard. If you need to go over an area just keep going over lightly. Not a lot pressure is needed. Easy emptying too.
  1638. It was better than I expected. It didn't remove all the pills on my polyester shirt, but probably 95%, which is very good. And it didn't grab and pull any threads
  1639. This device is meant for shaving off all those little fuzz balls that build up on some materials and can make a sweater, for example, look too well-worn. I remember when these devices were first introduced, and the manufacturers were so afraid of clothing damage that the holes were too small and then the product didn't even work (big fabric 'pills' could not fit into the holes to be snipped off!). Now some reviewers complain of fabric damage because now the holes are too big. So...what size hole in front of the blade is 'just right'? (sound like a Goldilocks story? :-) I think the size of the holes in this shaver are just right! Be aware that these type shavers are really designed for heavier type fabrics (think of sweaters, comforters, socks...) that tend to pill up easily (especially wools & fuzzy acrylics) and fabrics that are NOT very fragile, vs sheers and silks. So just be cautious if you choose to use it on more delicate fabrics. On delicate fabrics, I'd recommend the obvious: try an inconspicuous area first, and stretch the fabric very firmly while you shave it so it can't be pulled inside the device. Using this method (which really should be used no matter WHAT type of fabric!) I've shaved heavy fabrics and sheer fabrics, and not had any problems! I recommend! (I would have given this 5 stars if it was priced slightly lower)
  1640. wonderful, brought my wooly outdoor research hybrid coat to a brand new standstill.
  1641. Cheaply made. The battery cover doesn't stay on very well. Does an okay job.
  1642. It works great but one of the blades popped off while I was clearing the fuzz out and would not go back in properly. It still works but I have to be extra careful that the blade doesn't disappear. For the price, it was worth it to me to save a king-sized quilt from the garbage. I would actually purchase it again and be extra careful cleaning it out.
  1643. I really, really love this shaver. My neighbor lent me her inferior shaver and after an hour of little result I decided to purchase a better one myself. I could not be happier, great product for the price.
  1644. This fabric shaver does a great job for the price that I paid. I make sure to lay my garment on a flat surface and I'm good to go. I've run over seams and it hasn't caused any damage. It is easy to empty and even easier to use. I think it's great!
